Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Media, Entertainment and Publishing

abstract.p: Steve Case, chairman of America Online, which plans to merge with Time Warner, says events leading to ABC stations' being blocked from 3.5 million homes, result of dispute between Time Warner and Walt Disney Co, is not his problem yet; photo (S)

block.p: In that Disney opposes Time Warner's planned merger with America Online, Steve Case, AOL's chairman, had an interest in events leading to ABC stations' being blocked from 3.5 million homes. ''It's not really about retransmission rights'' but about Disney's and Time Warner's broader dealings, he said Monday night, shortly before a Columbia Business School fundraising dinner. ''Luckily, it's not my problem yet.''

Mr. Case, looking uncharacteristically uncasual in a tuxedo, was invited to receive the school's Millennium Award by Compaq's chairman, Benjamin M. Rosen, a 1961 graduate. ''Whatever Ben wants,'' Mr. Case said, adding that he was turned down by all the business schools he had applied to.
